name.ch: 活動大地構造暨地震地質

department.ch: 應用地質研究所碩士班

goal.en: Acquire the current knowledge on active fault behavior, master the concepts and techniques of active fault investigations from the earthquake cycle timescale to the timescale of 10-100-ka cumulative deformation, and learn how these findings apply to seismic hazard assessment. Audience: Graduate students and professionals from the fields of tectonics, structural geology, Quaternary geology, seismology, hazard assessment or civil engineering…
goal.ch: Acquire the current knowledge on active fault behavior, master the concepts and techniques of active fault investigations from the earthquake cycle timescale to the timescale of 10-100-ka cumulative deformation, and learn how these findings apply to seismic hazard assessment. Audience: Graduate students and professionals from the fields of tectonics, structural geology, Quaternary geology, seismology, hazard assessment or civil engineering…

content.en:
Lecture and discussion class on the following topics:
Mechanics, rheology, friction / Earthquake cycle, fault slip budget, seismicity / Geodetic methods / Tectonic geomorphology and fault geometries in extensional, compressional, strike-slip, and oblique settings / Earthquake ruptures, earthquake geology, paleoseismology / Quaternary geochronology / Active fault-related folding / Subsurface imaging of active faults / Seismic hazard and earthquake-induced hazards / Applications of earthquake geology for engineering geology and seismic hazard assessment.
content.ch:

textbook.en: - The Mechanics of Earthquakes and Faulting, by C. H. Scholz - Tectonic Geomorphology, by D. W. Burbank and R. S. Anderson - Paleoseismology by J. P. McCalpin (2009) - and other resources from scientific articles
